[h1]Inline CSS[/h1] Using an inline style is one of the ways to insert a style sheet. With an inline style, a unique style is applied to a single element. In order to use an inline style, add the [b]style attribute[/b] to the [b]relevant tag[/b]. quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to call an external stylesheet called "test.css":
[!raw!]
<head>
   <{0} rel="stylesheet" href="{1}.css">
{2}
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]External CSS[/h1] With this method, all styling rules are contained in a single text file, which is saved with the [b].css[/b] extension. This CSS file is then referenced in the HTML using the [b][/b] tag. The element goes inside the head section. Here is an example: [b]The HTML:[/b] [code format="html" ] <[b]link[/b] rel="stylesheet" href="example.css">

This is my first paragraph.

This is my second paragraph.

This is my third paragraph.

[/code] [b]The CSS:[/b] [code format="css" codeId="502"]p { color:white; background-color:gray; }[/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2583" width="100%"] [note]Both relative and absolute paths can be used to define the [b]href [/b]for the CSS file. In our example, the path is relative, as the CSS file is in the same directory as the HTML file.[/note]
